bill_title: make an appropriation to the Board of Regents for the construction, remodeling, or renovation of various structures or facilities on the campuses of the state's universities to provide additional support for women's athletic programs in furtherance of the policies and objectives of Title IX of the Education Act Amendments of 1972.

bill_versions.bill_text: FOR AN ACT ENTITLED, An Act to make an appropriation to the Board of Regents for the construction, remodeling, or renovation of various structures or facilities on the campuses of the state's universities to provide additional support for women's athletic programs in furtherance of the policies and objectives of Title IX of the Education Act Amendments of 1972. BE IT ENACTED BY THE LEGISLATURE OF THE STATE OF SOUTH DAKOTA: Section 1. The Board of Regents may contract for the construction, completion, furnishing, equipping, and maintaining of, including heating, air conditioning, plumbing, water, sewer, electric facilities, sidewalks, parking, landscaping, architectural and engineering services, asbestos abatement, removal of existing roofing and structures, and such other services or actions as may be required to accomplish the projects enumerated in section 3 of this Act, all at the estimated cost of three million one hundred fifty-three thousand one hundred sixty-five dollars. Section 2. There is hereby appropriated one million two hundred forty-three thousand two hundred seven dollars ($1,243,207) from the state general fund, two hundred seventy-seven thousand seven hundred forty dollars ($277,740) from the higher education facilities fund, and one million six hundred thirty-two thousand two hundred eighteen dollars ($1,632,218) from other funds available to the universities for the projects specified in section 3 of this Act. Section 3. The projects authorized in section 1 of this Act are the following projects, together with their pertinent appropriations: (1) At Black Hills State University in Spearfish, South Dakota, projects to upgrade a locker room, provide office space for coaches, and create practice and competition soccer fields, all for an estimated cost of one million one hundred thirty-five thousand seven hundred forty dollars, of which five hundred forty-one thousand three hundred twenty-one dollars ($541,321) are to be appropriated from the state general fund, two hundred thirty-nine thousand seven hundred forty dollars ($239,740) are to be appropriated from the higher education facilities fund allocated to the university as part of its annual maintenance and repair allocation, and five hundred fifty-four thousand six hundred seventy-nine dollars ($554,679) are to be appropriated from other funds available to the university; (2) At Dakota State University in Madison, South Dakota, projects to upgrade softball dugouts, acquire portable fencing for the softball field, upgrade the soccer field, and upgrade locker room space, all for an estimated cost of eighty-five thousand five hundred dollars, of which forty-four thousand four hundred ninety-nine dollars ($44,499) are to be appropriated from the state general fund, and forty-one thousand one dollars ($41,001) are to be appropriated from other funds available to the university; (3) At Northern State University in Aberdeen, South Dakota, projects to upgrade soccer fields and to provide office space for coaches, all for an estimated cost of thirty-four thousand five hundred dollars, of which nine thousand three hundred nineteen dollars ($9,319) are to be appropriated from the state general fund, and twenty-five thousand one hundred eighty-one dollars ($25,181) are to be appropriated from other funds available to the university; (4) At South Dakota School of Mines and Technology in Rapid City, South Dakota, a project to improve medical training facilities for an estimated cost of twenty thousand dollars, of which twenty thousand dollars ($20,000) are to be appropriated from other funds available to the university; (5) At South Dakota State University in Brookings, South Dakota, projects to upgrade locker rooms and softball facilities for an estimated cost of one million one hundred forty-six thousand four hundred twenty-five dollars, of which two hundred thirty thousand eight hundred forty-nine dollars ($230,849) are to be appropriated from the state general fund, thirty-eight thousand dollars ($38,000) are to be appropriated from higher education facilities funds allocated to the university as part of its annual maintenance and repair allocation, and eight hundred seventy-seven thousand five hundred seventy-six dollars ($877,576) are to be appropriated from other funds available to the university; (6) At the University of South Dakota in Vermillion, South Dakota, projects to renovate showers and locker rooms, to improve softball fields, tennis facilities, soccer fields and their seating, and to replace the Dakota Dome floor, all for an estimated cost of seven hundred thirty-one thousand dollars, of which four hundred seventeen thousand two hundred nineteen dollars ($417,219) are to be appropriated from the state general fund, and three hundred thirteen thousand seven hundred eighty-one dollars ($313,781) are to be appropriated from other funds available to the university. Section 4. The Board of Regents is authorized to design, bid, construct, and equip the locker room upgrade at South Dakota State University authorized by subdivision (5) of section 3 of this Act in conjunction or in combination with the wellness center facility authorized by chapter 120 of the Session Laws of 2004, if the board determines that doing so will advance the economy of the construction or enhance the functionality of the completed facility. Section 5. The Board of Regents may accept, transfer, and expend any funds obtained for these purposes from federal sources, gifts, contributions, or any other source, all of which shall be deemed appropriated to the projects authorized by this Act, in addition to the amounts otherwise authorized herein. Section 6. The design and construction of the facilities approved by this Act shall be under the general supervision of the Bureau of Administration as provided in § 5-14-2. Section 7. The commissioner of the Bureau of Administration and the executive director of the Board of Regents shall approve vouchers and the state auditor shall draw warrants to pay expenditures authorized by this Act.
